Someonerandm:

I was aiming that comment at him

You probably shouldn’t have quoted me then huh. Or at least addressed your comment at him by mentioning his name first.

Pro tip: If you quote someone, it generally means you’re replying to them and their comment. Don’t quote someone if you are aiming your comment at someone else if you don’t want to be mis-understood and look like a noob.

item.title: halo vs half life
item.dc:creator: Quintix256
item.description:
You know, Halo is actually the first modern PC fps (WASD+mouse) I ever played.
Its not as good as Half-Life, but I could see even then why Halo became Microsoft’s Sonic or Mario when they released it on the Xbox. It has many issues (as illustrated below), especially in single player, but overall it is a solid game.

Just think about it, the game was developed by (a very talented) apple game studio. The game would have died in obscurity on the Macintosh had Microsoft not rescued it.
Obligatory Cartoon:

350×1488 116 KB

Read full topic

item.title: halo vs half life
item.dc:creator: JohnKiller118
item.description:
How about this:

Goldeneye vs Half-Life

Goldeneye: Did nothing to revolutionize the genre. It is as generic as a FPS can get. It is only beloved because of nostalgic memories of being a child and playing it. And, as we all should know, kids are stupid.
Half-Life: Awesome game with great atmosphere. Revolutionizes storytelling in the FPS genre.

Let’s see why I hate Goldeneye as much as people here hate Halo…
Bad controls: At least the XBox controller had the decency to have TWO clickable joysticks and comfortable button placement. The N64, however, has the worst design layout ever. Plus, you’re never really aiming the gun. The auto-aim literally does almost all of the work for you! Sure, many console FPS games today have a little bit of auto-aim, but Goldeneye’s is just ridiculous. But you need it turned on because all you can do while aiming is move the camera around Left and Right. The only way to free-look is to hold down a button, but the camera doesn’t move the the reticule, and you can’t walk while in this mode.

Bad Gameplay: Just shoot everything. You can play stealth, which is cool, but the AI is awful! One time I walked up to a guy behind a computer, I was in what would be a NORMAL person’s line of sight, but he didn’t do shit! I shot him in the head and just laughed.
Also, the friendly NPC AI is garbage. Remember that level where you had to escort that chick in the blue dress and red hair? Worst escort level EVER! She didn’t even TRY to take cover.
Yeah, I know this is just the N64 we’re talking about, I’ve seen better AI in DOOM.

Multiplayer: I can’t say if this game’s mutliplayer is good or not, since my friend quit playing within 3 minutes. But from what I saw, it just isn’t that impressive to me. There were plenty of good FPS games on the PC that had great multiplayer (wasn’t Team Fortress 1 for the Quake engine released at the time?) As an added bonus, most of those games had ONLINE multiplayer.
Again, I know this is just the N64.

Hype: I can understand why people liked this as a child, since it was probably their first FPS and they probably had fond memories of playing multiplayer with friends. That’s cool. Thing is, Halo was my first FPS. and I have fond memories of playing multiplayer with friends. Neither games did nothing to revolutionize the FPS genre, but we all loved our respective overhyped FPS game for the nostalgia, and even today these games can be fun to play.
That’s all fine, but the hype for Goldeneye is just as bad or maybe WORSE than Halo! (But, you know, without the marketing.) It’s hailed by many people as “da gratest fps eva!!!1!!1!!”. This is even said by people who hate Halo, even though Goldeneye did about as much the the genre as Halo did (ie, nothing.)

I’m not saying anyone who likes Goldeneye is a “fucking faggot consol pussy lol”. If you like the game, that’s great! I’m just trying to make a point to any Halo-hatin’ Goldeneye fans.

I can’t wait to see all of your intelligent, well thought out, and respectful responses! [/sarcasm]

Read full topic
